Reviews.Title: “Good value for a short stay when it is cold”
Reviews.Author: radiationmd
Reviews.Content: This is a two star Hotel and the area is not the best, but if you just need to stay for a night and need a place to stay and don't want to spend much, it is perfect. The hotel has no AC so not good for summer at all. The TV was so small, it is essentially useless while you are laying down in the bed. The size of the room was pretty good for a two star Hotel although the bathroom is small yet functional. For 48 euros for two people, it was pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Dubious ......but it was ok!”
Reviews.Author: Palins_Pal
Reviews.Content: Wanted a few days away for a bit of father son bonding time and chose Berlin as it was an area he had not visited. Booked with Expedia, from a good number Berlin hotels. This hotel is cheap place to stay, rather than booking a twin room it was a room each at approx £19.00 per room per night. This normally would have alarm bells ringing, but Berlin is a cheaper city than most, and frankly this worked out to be more than value for money. Ok the good buffet breakfast was extra (15.00 Euro), but this hotel is good on your pocket!. No complaints about the staff. The rooms are neutral, if tired, but clean and very good sized. The bathrooms are unusually small, and the hotel is very much in the old east german vein. The location is not ideal with little in the way of bars and restaurants nearby, but the excellent U bahn is minutes away. Would agree with other reviewers about the illicit ladies prowling the streets, but what city does not have this attraction! In all a CHEAP place to stay, no palace, but for the price it fits the bill!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, cleanliness and comfort”
Reviews.Author: taniah
Reviews.Content: From previous reveiws and the bargain price that we paid I had expected the Agon Aldea hotel to be basic, however I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived late on a Friday evening and upon being given a room key opened the door to find other bags and belongings in the room. We returned to the front desk and were upgraded to an apartment suite (as they had no more standard rooms left). This room was very large, with a suitably large bathroom also. The only problem I had with the room was that there was no shower curtain with the bath so when you used the shower water went everywhere. Breakfast was also impressive. The buffet provided a wide choice with cereal, hot breakfast, fruit, cold meats and cheeses and a variety of breads and spreads. The location was the only minor downside. Yes, there are "ladies of the night" on the nearby corners at night, but I didnt really feel threatened by this. It is very near a U-Bahn station and whilst there are not a lot of local facilities around, areas such as Postdamer Platz with restaurants, shopping and a cinema, are only a short train ride away. I was pleasantly surprised by the helpfulness of all the staff, the room comfort and the quality of the breakfast and would definately stay here again on another trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: mickums
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Hotel is drab and shabby but the room was fine - warm, clean and comfortable. Small bathroom but everything worked - TV, safe,shower etc. Really good breakfast with plenty of choice and some fine breads, coffee pots on all tables provided (nice touch). The location is within walking distance of Potsdam Platz in one direction and Ku'Damm (shopping area) in the other. But its not a nice area; there are prostitutes working across the road from the hotel (though this is not a problem). There are very few proper restaurants nearby but plenty of small bistros. Unfortunately these seemed to function mainly as meeting places for men only (at night anyway). Friendly helpful staff, a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Kostas_St
Reviews.Content: Great location, simple hotel. Subway station was just 50m away, on the line to City-Center. Berlin is anyway a cheap city, Aldea Hotel too. For me and my wife, since we decided to select hotels near a sub-station, cause we're the whole day on the streets, this happended to be a perfect choice. Breakfast was pretty simple, but the hotel was quite and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Been there for the second time, still satisfied”
Reviews.Author: balaazs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Agon Aldea for the second time now, and I still think it's great-great value for money. It's an average 5-storey buliding located right next to a U-Bahn (subway) station (Bülowstrasse), 5 mins from two big hubs, Potsdamer Platz and Zoologischer Garten. The neighborhood is not pretty, but since it's this close to the city center, it didn't really matter to me. The rooms are not too big, but okay, with satellite tv, minibar and a small, but nice bathroom (with a shower). Towels and bedsheets are always clean. Breakfast's plenty. Staff is kind and polite. It's a three star-hotel with some major adjustments which make it a great deal to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & (Sort of) Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: zzyzxUK
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through Tripadvisor, and chose it mostly for the location (wanted to be near Nollendorfplatz) and cheap price. The location is fairly central, although the actual street it is on isn't the most bustling in Berlin, and there aren't lots of restaurants/shops in the immediate area if you're interested in anything after normal business hours (like late-night food, for example). The other reviewers are right about the prostitution... my room had a nice(?) view of several women streetwalking on the side streets behind the hotel, and there was even one standing outside the front of the hotel for most of the night. On the other hand, they -were- fairly discreet compared to the prostitutes in other cities (Madrid comes to mind), and they're only really obvious if you spend your time staring out the window of your hotel room watching what people are doing outside. (I usually don't). For the price, the hotel was actually not bad. The room was very clean, the maids friendly and efficient, and I found the desk staff friendly enough (even the older ones). The best reason to stay here has to be it's proximity to the U-Bahn, being just steps away from the central U2 line, which I found most useful. So, if you're on a budget, and don't mind a little "local colour", it's not a bad place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ifi
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel at a very low price! The room was very spacious and had an extra sofa, the bathroom was spotless and thoroughly cleaned evey day. Our room overlooked the car park and was extremely quiet. The hotel is central, right opposite to a U-Bahn station, though its neigborhood has not much to do or to see. I totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for longer stays”
Reviews.Author: 24hockey
Reviews.Content: As previously written it is a great value especially on the internet getting a the 6th day free!!! close to the ubahn...close to little fruit markets to get water and fruit for the day or night!!! Excellent cafe around the corner "CAFE NOIR" where we enjoyed a lighter breakfast then the 15 euro hotel buffet!!! Lots of tour buses and people in the lobby smoking but definatley worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: huhugrub
Reviews.Content: Despite the rather tired appearance and the slow lifts, the room was clean and reasonably spacious. The bathroom was very tiny (even for a small person) but well equipped. Our room opened to the hotel's car park and noise wasn't an issue even with the windows opened. The hotel was just opposite the U-bahn station and was reasonably convenient if spending more than a day in Berlin. Parking wasn't a problem as there were quite a lot of parking spaces across the street underneath the U-Bahn station. There were not a lot of eating places (mainly kebabs and a Thai nearby). The buffet breakfast was very filling and offered a wide variety of food. The front desk staff were not very knowledgeable about the facilities in the hotel's vicinity. Before we made the booking, we searched Google maps and knew there would be at least one laundromat nearby. However, when we asked the front desk staff, they couldn't point us to the nearest one but kept offering us the in-house laundry service. The night staff's reply was that they didn't know because they worked night shift and everything was closed! In the end, we used the internet terminal at the hotel and found the laundromat through Google maps. There was only one internet terminal in the lobby, which could mean a long wait in an area full of smokers! At EUR180 for 3 nights, this was good value for a tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: whizzkid1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had little to complain about. The reception area is not very inviting but the rooms themselves are clean and tidy and are of a similar standard to a travel inn room in the uk.the bathroom is really small but it is fully equipped and the shower is great.there is not a lot of interest nearby but the subway is only a short walk away. there is a pleasant italian restaurant nearby called centro sud but not a lot of other nearby eating delights! all in all for £81 for three nights it was good value!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money !”
Reviews.Author: gerrybhoy1
Reviews.Content: Was definitely a bit wary after reading some of the previous reviews. Was there last week for 4 days. Cost us about £21 each per night. For that price you may be lucky to get a backpacker hostel in some cities ! Definitely cant really complain. the hotel was fine. the room was exactly as it shows on the hotel website. toilet was - as mentioned before - pretty small, but spotless. As with the halls that have been mentioned before - how much time do you spend there - not a lot ! Because we couldn't be bothered with the maids coming in and tidying up our clothes, sheets, guides ,etc, we just left the "Do not Disturb" signs on the door during the day - each day we came back to find a bag hanging on the door with fresh towels, etc. !!! Hotel is just round the corner from subway station (Kurfustenstrabe, I think) and also a main street with loads of shops, etc. Public transport system is excellent. Subway just in front of hotel was still closed. If this is open, may be advisable to ask for room at back of hotel. The 3-day visitor cards can be bought from the hotel reception for 19.90 euros. Remember to get these validated before travelling. Never had any problems at night. Noticed a couple of transvestites at the street to the side of hotel, but nothing to talk about. Would'nt have any problem recommending this hotel if you get a similar good deal

Reviews.Title: “Pity about the U- Bahn”
Reviews.Author: AustroPolCanadaScot
Reviews.Content: Seven of us stayed at the Aldea for three nights from the 10th of February. It was excellent value. The fine buffet breakfast was welcome on the cold mornings. The rooms were well appointed and the staff were all very helpful and welcoming. If you are coming from Schoenefeld Airport, you can avoid the ticket machine queues by getting a one day or three day public transport tcket from the Lufthansa desk in the arrivals hall. It covers the buses, trams, regional trains, S-Bahn and U-Bahn. There is a bus stop just around the corner from the hotel. From the airport , come into Alexanderplatz Station on the train and then get a number 48 bus which takes you to the corner of Buelow Strasse. The U-Bahn, which would be even more convenient, U-Bahn 1, is out of commission at the moment, while a new line is being built.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KiwiLund
Reviews.Content: Got to this 4 star hotel after a long trip expecting an if not good then at least reasonably good hotel, it being 4 star. Found it expensive when it came to everything apart from the stay there and uncomfortable. The staff where, as opposed to what the travelwebsite said very unhelpful and just seemed to want to end the day. Breakfast was not included which was surprising since it had been included when booking and was also very expensive, 12 euros. The dinner restaurant, there where 2, was also quite expensive and horribly decorated in some failed combination of disco and homy style. As to the room the furniture, including the bed, where uncomfortable adn hard and the bathroom was tiny although relatively functional. You should definately not come expecting a 4 star hotel this is more like 2+ or possibly 3 star and quite okay at that level. On the positive side it was relatively central, but still a bit off, and quiet throughout the stay in spite of going for a weekend. It was clean enough although somewhat worn but quite good as a base for exploring the city. I wouldn't recommend it however because there's plenty of other hotels where you can get better value or at least a good hospitalitylevel and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Decent & inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: europa00
Reviews.Content: Was a little apprehensive after reading other reviews, but this hotel fit our needs - inexpensive hotel in a decent location for getting around Berlin. Was a short walk -- 5 minutes to the U because the S was not yet running. Had a view of the train line though from the hotel - but we could only here cars when we opened the window for fresh air. Hotel was very basic, TV did have english news station, but that was about it. But still entertaining to watch what was on german TV after a night out. Street doesn't seem the safest at night but wasn't traveling alone. Found a great restaurant, Cafe Vienna I believe it was called, a few blocks northwest of the hotel. Only issue we had was the staff who had to check the mini bar while we were getting going (rather late, after being out the night before) in the early afternoon. Would stay here again if we were able to get such a good deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Room 433”
Reviews.Author: rodica
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Schoenefeld at 2200 via Ryanair, and got the Airport Express train RE7 or RB14, which runs every half hour for only 2.10 euros. Big queues at ticket machines, but you can pay on the train. Arriving at Zoologischer Garten approaching midnight, so got a taxi for 6 euros to Hotel. In accordance with previous reviews, asked for room at the rear. Got room 108, which stunk like an ashtray, so we got an immediate swap to room 433. This was a massive room at the front and smelt brand new. However as the S Bahn was not running during the time we were there, noise was not a problem. Staff were all very helpful, but as I used airmiles to book holiday I couldn't comment on value. However, my wife and I had no complaints. As Buelowstrasse Station was closed, we used Kurfuerstenstrasse Station, which is a 5 minute walk away. Daily run around ticket (Tageskarte Zone AB) is only 5.80 euros and gives you a radius of about 15 miles travel on U Bahn, S Bahn, trams and buses. Be sure to validate your ticket in machine next to ticket dispenser before you get on the train. Many plain-clothes ticket inspectors, so don't be tempted to travel without ticket. I would grade the Hotel Aldea at 3 star +, certainly not usual 4 star, but handy for everything. Mick & Sue. Notts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: SmithS&B
Reviews.Content: We paid £100 for 3 nights in a twin room here so we were not expecting The Ritz. After reading reviews on here I was very pleasantly surprised. It cost 30 Euros in a taxi from Schonefeld airport. The check in staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is fine. Turn right out of the hotel and you have a 15 minute walk to Potsdamer Platz. Turn left and its 15 minutes to get to K'Damm. There is an underground station directly outside the hotel which was closed for building work when we were there. I would expect it to be noisy when it is open so try and request a room at the back. The rooms are fine. Very clean and tidy. Twin beds, sofa, chair, wardrobe & desk. The shower room is tiny but adequate. Towels could be doing with being replaced though as they were wearing a tad thin. The breakfast was lovely. Buffet style. Hot and cold food. Usual stuff. Never saw a hooker or a transvestite and we were wandering home quite late every night. I would stay here again. Berlin is a brilliant place. There is lots to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soldado
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 4 people, but was allowed to stay there with 5. We where five guys and needed to stay together. We had a single room but it almost contained two rooms (good for us) and lot of space. It was clean and the service from the staff was excellent. The hotel is located in Schöneberg area and it's in the heart of Berlin City. The only negative thing was that the bar closed so early that we had no chance to together with and learn to know the very good looking girls :o) I can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What we think”
Reviews.Author: emilymary
Reviews.Content: We have recently had a 5 day stay at the Aldea. The Hotel sits by a very busy crossroads . To the front of the Hotel, the Underground station runs across the front of the building above ground (this is now closed until 1st December 2006). However, it is extremely noisy when operating. To one side of the building, during the late evening/night, the street is taken over by Hookers and Transvestites. There is much horn honking and derisive shouting throughout the night from clients and passing cars. The Hotel has double glazing which minimises the noise but no air con. While we were there it was so hot, we needed the windows open. A fan deadened the noise and enabled us to get some sleep. The Hotel itself is very clean although somewhat dated. Our room was a good size, immaculately clean and the bedding and towels white but a little threadbare. The shower room, small but adequate. Our bedding was not changed during our stay. The complimentary toiletries consist of a combined wash/shower/shampoo liquid above the sink and in the shower cubicle. There is no complimentary 'hospitality tray' - but we do not know if these tea/coffee facilities are usual in other German establishments. We had a plumbing leak which was promptly dealt with by a very polite and helpful staff member. Some staff have a rather short, sharp manner but maybe this is the 'german way' rather than 'impolite indifference'. The Hotel is a 15/20 minute walk to the Kurfurstendam. The nearest Underground station (Kurfurstenstrasse) about a 4/5 minute walk. There are local shops and cafes nearby. We do not agree that this is a 4 star Hotel but we paid such a bargain price, we feel we still had our moneysworth. We would however feel very differently had we paid the standard rate of 165 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Aldea, Oh dear you mean!”
Reviews.Author: Miiky
Reviews.Content: Well! Where do you start? First this hotel is not 4 stars. (As we know it) The leaflet on the hotel looks great. Not sure they got the correct hotel. First sight is a grey un-interesting reception. Older staff there are miserable. Far too many anyway. Grey corridors lead to rooms. Room was big. No kettle etc. Did not have food which might have made a slight difference? Hookers in back street of hotel. Not a great area. Found it cheap on internet otherwise would not have gone there. Only stay if you can not find anything else. Not recommended at all.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have awarded this hotel 3 points as that is how many stars it should be rated, my main comparison being the Millenium Hotel in Glasgow which is also rated 4 stars (probably deserving of more). There is no room service ie. the receptionist sounded a bit surprised when I phoned to request a menu to have a meal in the room. I ordered the room from hotelopia.com which stated they did have room service but I presume what they actually mean is someone tidies and makes the bed. The staff were friendly and nice and the breakfast was a nice buffet although the surroundings could be better, but you're only there for half an hour or so, so not that important to me really. This hotel is in an excellent location, the U-bahn is a 60 second walk and only a couple of stops from the Zoological Garten meaning you can get to Tegel airport within half an hour by U-bahn and bus. Berlin is one of the most vibrant, metropolitan and wonderful cities I have ever had the great fortune to visit and so if you are looking for a docking bay form which to leave and visit the sights this hotel is perfect. The rooms are clean, quiet and comfortable, easily affordable, yes the bathroom is small but pretty and more than good enough. In fairness you probably shouldnt expect the Radisson SAS for the price and, look, your in Berlin! Who cares!

Reviews.Title: “Super spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the money we got this hotel at we we're very happy. Did my research through this site - And well pleased we chose this hotel based on the recent reviews. Our deal excluded breakfast which was 12 euro a pop - we skipped that preferring a local coffee shop. Our group consisted of 5 Lads - mid 20's - early 30's. If your group is similar to that then def go for the Aldea The hotel had modern clean rooms - tv - with a small modern shower room. - what more could we ask for! Can't comment on the public transport links as we had the car. Free Car parking on the street in front was a big bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: SEAMUS.R
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend, and having read some of the reviews on this site was a little aprehensive. However my fears were unfounded and I was pleasantly surprised. I'm not sure what people expect, but having prepaid €185.00 for a double room for three nights including breakfast, I felt we got much more than our money's worth. O.K so maybe it wasn't a 4 star hotel but it's a very good 3 star. While I have little interest in staying in ultra luxurious hotel (almost always a rip off) I am quite fussy, particularly about hygiene and queitness and a comfortable bed. The place was spotless, the staff were friendly, great breakfast. Why are some of the contributors so hung up on the hallways? (painted various shades of grey) as someone has already said how much time do you spend in a hotel hallway? From a location point of view it's less than two minutes walk from the nearest metro station, less than five minutes walk from Nollendorflatz, which is hopping with gay nightlife. I'd stay there again and recommend it to anyone. One small thing. The metro runs above the street so if you are a light sleeper you might want to get a room at the back of a hotel as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in this hotel. As per previous reviewer, was a little apprehensive after reading reports of gloomy depressing hallways and unhelpful staff. The staff that we came across were all very helpful and courteous. The hallways were a little on the depressing side, but seriously, how much time do you spend in your hotel hallway? The rooms were spacious enough, everything was spotlessly clean, beds were comfortable. Proved to be a perfect base for our trip to Berlin - we spent two nights there. The U2 U-bahn line runs past the door - the nearest station is a couple of minutes' walk. The U2 line takes you to places like Potsdamer Platz, Alexanderplatz, the Zoo etc. Would be hard to beat this hotel for value-for-money. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base!”
Reviews.Author: ferkh10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights over the New Year period. After reading some of the previous reviews we were very apprehensive about staying at this hotel, however it well exceeded our expectations. Okay it is a basic hotel but then we paid a basic price. The rooms are very clean, modern and comfortable. I would probably compare it to a Travellodge style hotel in the UK. The breakfast at the hotel was basic but adequate (what more do you want when you have a hangover!), and after reading a previous review about a lack of kettle in the room, took our own travel kettle. It is in a quiet, safe area and is literally just over the road from a U-Bahn station which is only 3 stops away from the main centre for the sights and transfers to other lines. There are numerous bars and restaurants 5 minutes walk away. If your purpose of visiting Berlin is for sightseeing and going out, and like us, all you want is a decently priced and comfortable base, then I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good location next to tube station....depressing building and unfriendly and unhelpful reception staff...great size of room though and great shower, ours was a twin, we had booked a double but were told on arrival that the hotel only has twins!......we did not have breakfast/meals here.....really just a clean place to stay with nothing whatsovever going for it...just a building and a bed - twin! To be avoided as there's loads of nice places to stay.....

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You could do worse with this hotel, but you could also do better...much better. I took this hotel for the low price and I definitely got what I paid for. The good: It's in an OK location (but definitely not a great location). It's right by the subway (U2 stop Bulowstr.). The area is very residential, but it's not too far to get to the tourist sites in East or West Berlin (I think it's in West Berlin, but relatively close to East). The area seems safe - just not much there. It's clean. The bad: NO air conditioning. NO INTERNET - only analog modem (phone), which costs 20 cents a minute! NO toll-free numbers can be called from the hotel so it doesn't matter if you have a calling card or not - calls are ridiculously expensive. NO SHAMPOO GIVEN! They just give you some liquid soap and that's it. Old elevator - you need to open the door yourself and there isn't even a light to tell you if it's there or not. Everything in the room and hallways is cheap and ugly, including the safe, which is battery powered and hard to work. That about sums it up. In a nutshell, you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean enough and the breakfast OK but the rest of the building is like a prison with the corridors being a very depressing grey colour. Was in Berlin for Pride so the location was good for that. Not sure I'd go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Basic yet pristine - Good if you get it cheaply”
Reviews.Author: 7DegreesOfWonderment
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel if you get a very good internet rate - shop around. Yet if you do get a good rate it can be worth it. I have stayed at this hotel on two or three occassions - twice over easter (2002 and 2001). On each occassion I booked very much last minute and chose the hotel for its location and especially the rate I got. The hotel feels a bit institutional - rooms are cheerful compact with modern furniture, bathrooms tiny but all is well maintained and clean. It is true that the corridors are dark and lifeless! It i located very close to an easily acessed subway station. The staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartinThomas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Aldea over Easter from 26 to 29 March 2005. The hotel is 2 minute walk from two U-Bahn stations, and very close to all the tourist sites. The area is a little rough, and there are a few prostitutes in the area, but this is minimal. The hotel staff were all very friendly, the rooms clean and modern, and the buffet breakfast plentiful. For £61 for a twin room with breakfast you cannot complain! For any gay tourists there are lots of bars within a 5 minute walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: AthensTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend in Aldea Hotel for 3 nights. We would have stayed there for 4 nights but the night we arrived the receptionist informed us that there was a problem with our room and he had arranged that we would spend the first night at another hotel. which was also a very nice hotel. The second day we went back at the hotel, where everything was ok and a great basket with fruits and chocolates was expecting us in our room with a regreting letter from the hotel manager. The personnel was very polite and helpful. The room was ample, clean and very warm. The breakfast was also great. It included eggs, sausages, bread, a great variety of cheese and ham, and fruits. Also the hotel was very close to an U-bahn station and we did not have a transportation problem. I am thinking of visiting Berlin in summer and I would definetely stay to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Grey & Lacking in Character”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in this hotel and wouldn't stay there again. The hotel is grey and lacking in soul. Whilst the hotel was clean, close to an underground station and the breakfasts were good presumably there are alot of other hotels that have these characteristics and have a bit of colour about them . The best thing about this hotel was the little Italian Restaurant 100m down from the hotel. As another reviewer commented there were also prostitutes in the area. If you do stay here make sure you block the pay for view TV as soon as you check in. They have this crazy system were if you watch a pay for view channel for more than 2 mins you are charged over 9 euro. Don't think you will be warned that you are about to be charged or that you are on a Pay TV channel. We were charged and hadn't watched anything other than the usual flicking through channels and felt ripped off.
